definition: Hmong or Miao ethnic group of southwest China/surname Miao

sentences.english: The seedlings of cereal crops began to upspring after the rain.
Rain and dew drops nourish young seedlings.
The timely rain revived the droughtstricken crops.
sentences.chinese: 這場及時雨使受旱的禾苗都緩過來了。

sentences.english: Three feet seedlings, rain last night.
sentences.chinese: 禾苗長三尺，雨露昨夜功。

sentences.english: Dayan flying into heading Hemiao stretch into words.
sentences.chinese: 大雁翱翔成標題，禾苗舒展成字句。

sentences.english: Everyday the anxious farmer would measure the growth of the crops.
sentences.chinese: 莊稼長出禾苗以後，他每天都去觀看。

sentences.english: A sweet rain falls on the parched seedlings.
It has been in the seedlings of swaddling clothes look forward to for a long time, finally his head.
sentences.chinese: 它已在禾苗的襁褓中期待了許久，終於露出了頭。

sentences.english: His son went to the field only to discover that all of his crops were all dead.
sentences.chinese: 他的兒子趕忙跑到田裏去看，禾苗全都枯萎了。

definition: to have the ears of grain come up
(of plants) to turn green again/to revegetate
embankment or foothpath between paddy fields
